oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1942-11-28 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 28, 1942. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Rachel Veach, Bashful Brother Oswald, Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys with vocalists San Antonio Rose and Eddy Arnold, the John Daniel Quartet, Pap's Jug Band, and Minnie Pearl. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Pee Wee King; Golden West Cowboys; Eddy Arnold; Minnie Pearl; Roy Acuff
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: George D. Hay introduces Eddy Arnold with Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys -- God Must Have Loved America (Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys, Eddy Arnold) -- George D. Hay introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- Bury Me Beneath The Willow (Minnie Pearl) -- Prince Albert commercial (Louie Buck, George D. Hay) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- Don't Make Me Go To Bed And I'll Be Good (Roy Acuff) -- Louie Buck talks -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- Ida Red (Roy Acuff) -- Closing statement (George D. Hay, Bashful Brother Oswald)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Bashful Brother Oswald; Veach, Rachel; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; King, Pee Wee, 1914-2000; Golden West Cowboys (Musical group); Arnold, Eddy, 1918-2008; John Daniel Quartet; Pap's Jug Band; Wilson, Lonnie; Minnie Pearl
